meanings.definition: Difficult or challenging tasks or situations.
meanings.sent1: Completing all these toughies can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent2: The students found the toughies in the math test to be very hard.
meanings.sent3: The toughies of climbing the mountain made them feel accomplished.
meanings.sent4: Facing the toughies in life is like climbing a steep mountain.
meanings.sent5: The toughies ahead seemed like an insurmountable obstacle.

meanings.sent1: The toughies fabric of the bag lasted for years.
meanings.sent2: The toughies shoes were able to withstand rough terrain.
meanings.sent3: The toughies material of the jacket kept him warm in the snow.
meanings.sent4: Her toughies spirit helped her overcome many obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The toughies armor protected the knight in battle.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something difficult or challenging.
meanings.sent1: She toughies the long work hours by staying focused.
meanings.sent2: He toughies the pressure of the competition by staying calm.
meanings.sent3: They toughies the unexpected change with a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: Learning to toughies obstacles is an important life skill.
meanings.sent5: The team must toughies the challenges together to succeed.
